Inline documentation¶

class lin_flowgraph_abstract.flowgraph(states: ~lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState, flowedges: (<class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.Edge_program'>, typing.Dict))¶

Directed Graph with rdfgraphs as nodes and programs as edges. Shows with which program you can get from one state to another.

create_directionmap_for_output(possible_endgraphs)¶

Find mapping of states to next state to reach one state of possible_endgraphs fastest.

Return type:

Dict[ datastate, Edge_program ]

classmethod from_programs(programs: Iterable[Program], function_find_startstates: Callable[[Program], Iterable[GraphState]], limit_flowgraph_size=True)¶

Produces reachable states from programs. If a state can be generated via a program from another state, this program cant wont be used to create new states from this state on.

Parameters:

limit_flowgraph_size – If this parameter is set, the maximal number of contained states is limited to 5**number of programs

Todo:

use abbrevations for edgetypes for debugging logging

Todo:

change use of translation to use of new axioms, when creating new offspring graphstates

get_possible_processes(inputstate: GraphState, outputstates: Optional[GraphState] = None, neighbouring_graphstates=True)¶

Find out which program can be used on inputstate. Can be filtered by programs, that can produce outputstate.

Parameters:

  • neighbouring_graphstates (bool) – If unset to False also searches programs, which may lead to graphstate if this method is called repeatedly. Or searches for indirect connections to outputstates and returns the first programs, that can be used

  • target_superstates (bool) – If set will search for superstates of given outputstates instead of the outputstates themselve

Return type:

Iterable[ Dict, program ]

Returns:

list of translation of input and the program useable on inputstate and producing outputstate

Todo:

asserts react first, when the generate is iterated

class lin_flowgraph_abstract.graphstate(rdfgraph, rename=False, immutable_resources=None)¶

State exemplified, by a rdfgraph. Graph consists only of axioms consisting of at minimum 1 BNode. Different graphstates are the same, if they are isomorph to each other.

Variables:

rdfgraph – Graph resembling this state

spawn_prev_state_from_program(program, rename=True)¶
Return type:

Iterable[ GraphState ]

classmethod spawn_starting_states_from_program(myprogram: program, rename=True)¶

Use this method as input for flowgraph.from_programs for parameter function_find_starstates. This method should create a set of possible starting states, from which the rest of the graph can be ascertained by usage of programs. (Just use inputgraph)

Return type:

Iterable[ GraphState ]

class lin_flowgraph_abstract.program_iterator(flowgraph, input_outputgraphs, missing_nodes, used_wholegraph)¶
class lin_flowgraph_abstract.rdfgraph_flowgraph(states: ~lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState, flowedges: (<class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class 'lin_flowgraph_abstract._flowgraph.Edge_program'>, typing.Dict))¶
complete_datagraph(wholegraph, ignore_nodes=[rdflib.term.URIRef('http://program/automaton#generation_target'), rdflib.term.URIRef('http://program/automaton#generation_successful')])¶

Filters the given graph to all resources, that are interesting in the terms of this flowgraph. So that only nodes are inside this, that are either missing or usable by any program, used in this flowgraph. Finds all creatable nodes, by the programs in this flowgraph. Finds all subgraphs, used when creating missing resources.

find_partgraphs(wholegraph, minimal_graph_size=1)¶

Uses superstates in this flowgraph to find subgraphs to these superstates in wholegraph. For superstates see self._get_superstates. Subgraphs of the wholegraph are node-induced subgraphs from wholegraph.

Parameters:

  • wholegraph – Wholegraph, for which partgraphs will be extracted. Partgraphs will only be represented as set of nodes. See returnvalue for more information

  • minimal_graph_size (int) – minimal size of extracted partgraphs from wholegraph

Return type:

Dict[ flowgraph.GraphState, List[ Dict[Node, Node] ] ]

Returns:

Mapping of all superstates in this flowgraph to a translation nodes to nodes. The translation translates from the nodes in the superstate to nodes in wholegraph. Partgraphs extracted from wholegraph are present as values of each translation.

automatic-generation-pathfinder
